text: Blata is a village in the Lika region of Croatia, in the municipality of Saborsko, Karlovac County. ==History== ==Culture== ==Demographics== According to the 2011 census, the village of Blata has 54 inhabitants. This represents 174.19% of its pre-war population according to the 1991 census. The 1991 censusIzdanje Državnog zavoda za statistiku RH: Narodnosni sastav stanovništva RH od 1880-1991. godine. recorded that 96.77% of the village population were ethnic Serbs (30/31) and 3.23% were of other ethnic origin (1/31). : ==Sights== * Blaćansko lake == Notable natives and residents== ==See also == * Saborsko massacre ==References== Category:Populated places in Karlovac County Category:Serb communities in Croatia
title: Blata, Croatia
